site_title: F-14 Tomcat by Michael G. LaFosse

block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: This origami jet stole my heart the first time I folded it. I just spent the whole week folding it. It amazed me by how much it resembles a real fighter jet and is still able to fly. This the F-15 Tomcat designed by Michael G. LaFosse. A wonderful origami jet that flies far. I hope you will enjoy it as much as I do. If you missed my last Exotic Paper Airplane "Paper Plane 040 : Love is in the Air by Francis Ow", you could watch it at https://youtu.be/7flFBQkHBRQ Thanks For Watching! Wilson Lee @Heap Art F-14 Tomcat by Michael G. LaFosse Tutorial Timeline: 00:00 Demonstration 00:19 Paper Size 00:35 Start folding 02:10 Opening up to the modified waterbomb base 03:00 Squashing all flaps of the modified waterbomb base 05:19 Separating the components of the F-14 Tomcat 05:35 Pedal fold 07:00 Forming the Leading Edge of the Wings 09:10 Folding the Elevators of the F-14 Tomcat 10:10 Forming the Trailing Edge of the Wings 11:51 Forming the Fuselage of the F-14 Tomcat 13:48 Folding the Leading Edge of the Elevators 14:15 Folding the Vertical Fins of the F-14 Tomcat 15:00 Creasing the Elevators 15:30 Folding the paper airplane in half 15:33 Locking the Fuselage 15:50 Opening up the wings 17:00 Straightening the fins 17:20 How to Throw 17:25 How to Tune
